question.text:
Read the following statements (i) to (v)

(i) During transcription, adenine pairs with uracil.
(ii) The human genome has about 98% of junk DNA.
(iii) A human gene on an average contains 3000 bps and there are about 30,000 genes in the human genome.
(iv) Y-chromosome of the human genome has the least number of genes, i.e., 321 in the human genome.
(v) Western blot is used to detect proteins.

How many statements are CORRECT?

solution.text:
Transcription is one of the process of protein synthesis where mRNA is synthesized from DNA. In this process, adenine pairs with uracil as RNA has uracil instead of thymine.

Western blot is a technique to detect proteins from a mixture based on their molecular weight which is run through gel electrophoresis.

Our genome contains the instructions to make proteins which regulate the body processes. Although, only 2% of the total genome contains the information for gene expression and rest 98% is considered to be junk.

Human male cells have 23 pairs of chromosomes of which 23rd pair is the sex chromosomes. It has X and Y chromosomes. In it the Y chromosome is the smallest chromosome having approximately 231 genes.

Human genome has approximately 3 billion chemical base pairs with 20000-25000 genes in the DNA.
